message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.LO

This paper presents an approach for dynamic information flow control across the application and database, which involves aspects of security (cs.CR), database systems (cs.DB), programming languages (cs.PL), software engineering (cs.SE), and logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper discusses a programming model that factors out information flow policies from application code and database queries, and presents proofs of termination-insensitive non-interference and policy compliance for the semantics. The implementation is done in a Python web framework, which also falls under the software engineering category. Therefore, the most likely categories are cs.CR and cs.DB, followed by cs.PL, cs.SE, and cs.LO.
